Get started

inboxy bundles together emails that share the same labels. Bundles make it easier to manage and view related emails.

To get the most out of inboxy, you can set up bundles by creating Gmail filters. Read on to learn about setting up bundles, key features, and preferred Gmail settings.

Contents
  • Set up bundles by creating filters
  • Pinning messages
  • Archiving messages
  • Preferred Gmail settings

Set up bundles by creating filters

inboxy uses labels to bundle messages. You can set up Gmail filters to automatically label emails that match criteria that you specify. When you receive these emails, inboxy will display them in a bundle corresponding to their label.

There are a few ways to create and manage filters. The search box offers an easy way to create a new filter.

1
Open the search form
Click the down arrow to open the form on the search bar.
2
Enter filter criteria
Fill out the form with criteria to match messages of interest, ex. enter “*@acme.com” in the “From” field to filter email from the acme.com domain.
3
Choose a label
Check “Apply the label” and select a label. Then click “Create filter” to save the filter.

Pinning messages

You can pin important bundled messages by starring them. Pinned messages will appear in their own row outside of their bundle.

Archiving messages

Messages in a bundle can be archived easily, with a single click. You can archive all messages in a bundle, that are on the current page. Messages in each date section can also be archived in the same way.

Preferred Gmail settings

inboxy primarily supports the default Gmail settings. Here are the recommended settings that work best with inboxy:

  • Default inbox type. inboxy supports this layout regardless of whether the category tabs are shown (Primary, Social, Promotions, etc.).
  • Show 100 conversations per page (the maximum number).
  • English language. When Gmail is not using English, bundling may work, but the date sections will not appear.
  • Labels should be shown in the message list, which is the default behavior.

Options

Labels
Add the name of each bundle on a new line. For nested labels, use forward-slashes between the nesting hierarchy levels.

Help

Got feedback?

You can send feedback through the support tab in the Chrome store listing, or by submitting an issue on Github. You can report bugs, ask questions, or share suggestions.

Release notes

To see what's new in recent releases, see the release notes on Github.

About inboxy

inboxy is an open-source browser extension that brings bundles to Gmail. To learn more, visit inboxymail.com.
